Introduction

Lux Plugin Manager - A powerful tool for managing VM plugins and subnets in the Lux Network

Lux Plugin Manager (LPM)

LPM is the official command-line tool for managing virtual machine (VM) plugins and subnets in the Lux Network ecosystem. It provides a streamlined interface for installing, updating, and managing blockchain plugins with enterprise-grade reliability.

Features

  • VM Plugin Management: Install, update, and uninstall VM binaries seamlessly
  • Repository Management: Support for multiple plugin repositories with Git integration
  • Subnet Operations: Join and manage subnet configurations effortlessly
  • Private Repository Support: Secure authentication for enterprise repositories
  • State Management: Robust tracking of installed plugins and configurations
  • Admin API Integration: Direct communication with Lux node administration
  • Cross-Platform: Works on Linux, macOS, and Windows
  • Production Ready: Battle-tested with comprehensive test coverage

Quick Start

Architecture Overview

LPM follows a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns:

  • Core Engine: Orchestrates workflows and manages state
  • Repository System: Handles Git operations and plugin discovery
  • Admin Client: Interfaces with Lux node administration API
  • State Manager: Persists installation registry and configurations
  • Workflow Executor: Implements command business logic

Core Concepts

Virtual Machines (VMs)

Custom blockchain implementations that run on the Lux network. Each VM defines its own rules for processing transactions and maintaining state.

Subnets

Independent blockchain networks within the Lux ecosystem, each running one or more VMs with custom validation rules.

Repositories

Git-based collections of VM definitions and subnet configurations. LPM supports both public and private repositories.

Plugin Directory

The local filesystem location where VM binaries are installed, typically at:

System Requirements

  • Go: Version 1.21 or higher
  • Git: For repository operations
  • Lux Node: Running node for admin API operations
  • Disk Space: Minimum 500MB for plugins
  • Network: Internet connection for repository access

Configuration

LPM uses a hierarchical configuration system:

  1. Default Values: Built-in sensible defaults
  2. Config File: Optional YAML configuration via --config-file
  3. Environment Variables: Override specific settings
  4. Command Flags: Highest priority for runtime customization

Default Paths

  • LPM Directory: ~/.lpm/ - State files and repositories
  • Plugin Directory: $GOPATH/src/github.com/luxfi/node/build/plugins/
  • State File: ~/.lpm/state.yaml
  • Lock File: ~/.lpm/lpm.lock
